thread.title: Heterosexual couple lose Court of Appeal battle to enter into civil partnership
thread.title_full: Heterosexual couple lose Court of Appeal battle to enter into civil partnership

author: Saphora Smith
title: Heterosexual couple lose Court of Appeal battle to enter into civil partnership
text:
Tuesday 21 February 2017 10:13 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard The couple outside the Court of Appeal on Tuesday Charlotte Ball/PA 
Heterosexual couple Rebecca Steinfeld and Charles Keidan have lost their Court of Appeal battle for the right to enter into a civil partnership rather than marry. 
Dr Steinfeld and Mr Keidan, of Hammersmith, had claimed they were the victims of discrimination and argued that the Government’s position on civil partnerships was “incompatible with equality law”. 
The couple, who have been in a committed relationship since November 2010 and have an 20-month-old baby, wanted to secure legal recognition of that relationship through a civil partnership. 
But today the Court of Appeal upheld a previous ruling that the 2004 Civil Partnership Act should only apply to same-sex couples. 
This story is being updated More about:
